etymologies: mid 19th century; earliest use found in Mona's Herald. From Manx carval, apparently from English carol

definitions: A ballad composed in Manx Gaelic on a Christian subject, traditionally sung in church after the Christmas Eve service.

notes.text: Carvals form the bulk of original literary composition produced in Manx prior to the 20th century, some examples being more than a hundred lines in length.
